document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality and data.
“La Paz, Bolivia ” (T, ♀ , OHSU )
.

World distribution. Bolivia , Peru and Chile .
Chilean distribution. From Arica y Parinacota to Antofagasta region ( Fig. 146 ).
Altitudinal range. This species mainly inhabits highland ecosystems between 2,700 and 4,200 m .a.s.l.

Biology and notes.
Copestylum bolivianum
is associated with native flora from the Andes highlands in the Puna. The species
Volucella arica
included in the catalog of Etcheverry (1963) is currently a junior synonym of
C. bolivianum
in the Systema Dipterorum ( Thompson & Pape 2010 ). Mining and water exploitation could be the major threats to this species. Nothing is known about the biology of this species.
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 55,351 km 2 , AOO = 64 km 2 and 15 localities (or subpopulations).
